name: ART 138
title: Facture and Meaning
description: Explores the materials and history of painting through lectures, demonstrations, and practice in oils, egg tempera, distemper, and Flashe paint. Students participate in group practices and also work independently on projects designed by them in consultation with the instructor. A foundation in drawing is recommended. May be repeated for credit.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): One from ART  20J, ART 130, ART 133, ART 137, ART 139; and two non-painting lower-division studios from ART 15, ART 20G, ART 20H, ART 20I, ART 20K, ART 20L, ART 26. Enrollment is  restricted to art majors.
courses: P O  ART  20J ART 130 ART 133 ART 137 ART 139
ART 15 ART 20G ART 20H ART 20I ART 20K ART 20L ART 26 E

class_notes: Please be advised that this course will heavily involve drawing and painting nude models.
